verses.verse: תִּמְשֹׁ֣ךְ <WH4900> tim-Shoch Canst thou draw out לִוְיָתָ֣ן <WH3882> liv-ya-Tan leviathan בְּחַכָּ֑ה <WH2443> be-chak-Kah; angle וּ֝בְחֶ֗בֶל <WH2256> u-ve-Che-vel, with a cord תַּשְׁקִ֥יעַ <WH8257> tash-Ki-a' [which] thou lettest down לְשֹׁנֽוֹ׃ <WH3956> le-sho-No. his tongue

הֲתָשִׂ֣ים <WH7760> ha-ta-Sim Canst thou put אַגְמ֣וֹן <WH100> ag-Mon an hook בְּאַפּ֑וֹ <WH639> be-'ap-Po; his nose וּ֝בְח֗וֹחַ <WH2336> u-ve-Cho-ach, bramble תִּקּ֥וֹב <WH5344> tik-Kov pierce לֶֽחֱיוֹ׃ <WH3895> le-che-yo. his jaw

הֲיַרְבֶּ֣ה <WH7235> ha-yar-Beh Will he make many אֵ֭לֶיךָ <WH413> 'E-lei-cha about תַּחֲנוּנִ֑ים <WH8469> ta-cha-nu-Nim; supplications אִם־ <WH518> 'im- Or יְדַבֵּ֖ר <WH1696> ye-dab-Ber unto thee;will he speak אֵלֶ֣יךָ <WH413> 'e-Lei-cha to you רַכּֽוֹת׃ <WH7390> rak-Kot. soft

הֲיִכְרֹ֣ת <WH3772> ha-yich-Rot Will he make בְּרִ֣ית <WH1285> be-Rit a covenant עִמָּ֑ךְ <WH5973> 'im-Mach; will you תִּ֝קָּחֶ֗נּוּ <WH3947> tik-ka-Chen-nu, with thee;wilt thou take לְעֶ֣בֶד <WH5650> le-'E-ved him for a servant עוֹלָֽם׃ <WH5769> o-Lam. alway

הַֽתְשַׂחֶק־ <WH7832> hat-sa-chek- Wilt thou play בּ֭וֹ bo כַּצִּפּ֑וֹר <WH6833> katz-tzip-Por; A bird וְ֝תִקְשְׁרֶ֗נּוּ <WH7194> ve-tik-she-Ren-nu, bind לְנַעֲרוֹתֶֽיךָ׃ <WH5291> le-na-'a-ro-Tei-cha. damsel

יִכְר֣וּ <WH3738> yich-Ru dig עָ֭לָיו <WH5921> 'A-lav over חַבָּרִ֑ים <WH2271> chab-ba-Rim; Shall the companions יֶ֝חֱצ֗וּהוּ <WH2673> ye-che-Tzu-hu, of him;shall they part בֵּ֣ין <WH996> bein among כְּֽנַעֲנִֽים׃ <WH3669> Ke-na-'a-Nim. Canaanite

הַֽתְמַלֵּ֣א <WH4390> hat-mal-Le Canst thou fill בְשֻׂכּ֣וֹת <WH7905> ve-suk-Kot harpoons עוֹר֑וֹ <WH5785> o-Ro; his skin וּבְצִלְצַ֖ל <WH6767> u-ve-tzil-Tzal cymbal דָּגִ֣ים <WH1709> da-Gim with fish רֹאשֽׁוֹ׃ <WH7218> ro-Sho. his head

שִׂים־ <WH7760> sim- Lay עָלָ֥יו <WH5921> 'a-Lav and כַּפֶּ֑ךָ <WH3709> kap-Pe-cha; thine hand זְכֹ֥ר <WH2142> ze-Chor upon him remember מִ֝לְחָמָ֗ה <WH4421> mil-cha-Mah, the battle אַל־ <WH408> 'al- shall not תּוֹסַֽף׃ <WH3254> to-Saf. do no more

הֵן־ <WH2005> hen- Behold תֹּחַלְתּ֥וֹ <WH8431> to-chal-To Behold the hope נִכְזָ֑בָה <WH3576> nich-Za-vah; of him is in vain הֲגַ֖ם <WH1571> ha-Gam even אֶל־ <WH408> 'el- nay מַרְאָ֣יו <WH4758> mar-'Av even at the sight יֻטָֽל׃ <WH2904> yu-Tal. shall not [one] be cast down

לֹֽא־ <WH3808> lo- No אַ֭כְזָר <WH393> 'Ach-zor None [is so] fierce כִּ֣י <WH3588> ki dares יְעוּרֶ֑נּוּ <WH5782> ye-'u-Ren-nu; to arouse וּמִ֥י <WH4310> u-Mi Who ה֝֗וּא <WH1931> Hu, he לְפָנַ֥י <WH6440> le-fa-Nai before יִתְיַצָּֽב׃ <WH3320> yit-yatz-Tzav. who then is able to stand

מִ֣י <WH4310> mi Who הִ֭קְדִּימַנִי <WH6923> Hik-di-ma-ni Who hath prevented וַאֲשַׁלֵּ֑ם <WH7999> va-'a-shal-Lem; me that I should repay תַּ֖חַת <WH8478> Ta-chat כָּל־ <WH3605> kol- the whole הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם <WH8064> hash-sha-Ma-yim [him;whatsoever is] under the whole heaven לִי־ li- הֽוּא׃ <WH1931> Hu. he

לֹא־ lo- כלֹֽו־ <WH3808> lov- I will not אַחֲרִ֥ישׁ <WH2790> 'a-cha-Rish I will not conceal קבַּדָּ֑יו <WH905> bad-Dav; his limbs וּדְבַר־ <WH1697> u-de-var- act גְּ֝בוּר֗וֹת <WH1369> ge-vu-Rot, his mighty וְחִ֣ין <WH2433> ve-Chin nor his comely עֶרְכּֽוֹ׃ <WH6187> er-Ko. proportion

מִֽי־ <WH4310> mi- Who גִ֭לָּה <WH1540> Gil-lah Who can discover פְּנֵ֣י <WH6440> pe-Nei the face לְבוּשׁ֑וֹ <WH3830> le-vu-Sho; apparel בְּכֶ֥פֶל <WH3718> be-Che-fel [to him] with his double רִ֝סְנ֗וֹ <WH7448> ris-No, bridle מִ֣י <WH4310> mi Who יָבֽוֹא׃ <WH935> ya-Vo. come

דַּלְתֵ֣י <WH1817> dal-Tei the doors פָ֭נָיו <WH6440> Fa-nav accept מִ֣י <WH4310> mi Who פִתֵּ֑חַ <WH6605> fit-Te-ach; Who can open סְבִיב֖וֹת <WH5439> se-vi-Vot round about שִׁנָּ֣יו <WH8127> shin-Nav his teeth אֵימָֽה׃ <WH367> 'ei-Mah. [are] terrible

גַּ֭אֲוָה <WH1346> Ga-'a-vah [are his] pride אֲפִיקֵ֣י <WH650> 'a-fi-Kei brook מָֽגִנִּ֑ים <WH4043> ma-gin-Nim; scales סָ֝ג֗וּר <WH5462> sa-Gur, shut up together חוֹתָ֥ם <WH2368> cho-Tam seal צָֽר׃ <WH6862> Tzar. [as with] a close

אֶחָ֣ד <WH259> 'e-Chad One בְּאֶחָ֣ד <WH259> be-'e-Chad to another יִגַּ֑שׁוּ <WH5066> yig-Ga-shu; is so near וְ֝ר֗וּחַ <WH7307> ve-Ru-ach, that no air לֹא־ <WH3808> lo- no יָב֥וֹא <WH935> ya-Vo can come בֵֽינֵיהֶֽם׃ <WH996> Vei-nei-Hem. between

אִישׁ־ <WH376> 'ish- one בְּאָחִ֥יהוּ <WH251> be-'a-Chi-hu to another יְדֻבָּ֑קוּ <WH1692> ye-dub-Ba-ku; They are joined יִ֝תְלַכְּד֗וּ <WH3920> yit-lak-ke-Du, they stick together וְלֹ֣א <WH3808> ve-Lo and cannot יִתְפָּרָֽדוּ׃ <WH6504> yit-pa-Ra-du. that they cannot be sundered

עֲ‍ ֽ֭טִישֹׁתָיו <WH5846> 'aTi-sho-tav By his neesings תָּ֣הֶל <WH1984> Ta-hel doth shine א֑וֹר <WH216> or; a light וְ֝עֵינָ֗יו <WH5869> ve-'ei-Nav, and his eyes כְּעַפְעַפֵּי־ <WH6079> ke-'af-'ap-pei- [are] like the eyelids שָֽׁחַר׃ <WH7837> Sha-char. of the morning

מִ֭פִּיו <WH6310> Mip-piv Out of his mouth לַפִּידִ֣ים <WH3940> lap-pi-Dim burning lamps יַהֲלֹ֑כוּ <WH1980> ya-ha-Lo-chu; go כִּיד֥וֹדֵי <WH3590> ki-Do-dei [and] sparks אֵ֝֗שׁ <WH784> 'Esh, of fire יִתְמַלָּֽטוּ׃ <WH4422> yit-mal-La-tu. leap out

מִ֭נְּחִירָיו <WH5156> Min-ne-chi-rav Out of his nostrils יֵצֵ֣א <WH3318> ye-Tze goeth עָשָׁ֑ן <WH6227> 'a-Shan; smoke כְּד֖וּד <WH1731> ke-Dud pot נָפ֣וּחַ <WH5301> na-Fu-ach as [out] of a seething וְאַגְמֹֽן׃ <WH100> ve-'ag-Mon. or caldron

נַ֭פְשׁוֹ <WH5315> naf-sho His breath גֶּחָלִ֣ים <WH1513> ge-cha-Lim coals תְּלַהֵ֑ט <WH3857> te-la-Het; kindleth וְ֝לַ֗הַב <WH3851> ve-La-hav, and a flame מִפִּ֥יו <WH6310> mip-Piv of his mouth יֵצֵֽא׃ <WH3318> ye-Tze. goeth out

בְּֽ֭צַוָּארוֹ <WH6677> be-tzav-va-ro In his neck יָלִ֣ין <WH3885> ya-Lin remaineth עֹ֑ז <WH5797> 'Oz; strength וּ֝לְפָנָ֗יו <WH6440> u-le-fa-Nav, before תָּד֥וּץ <WH1750> ta-Dutz is turned into joy דְּאָבָֽה׃ <WH1670> de-'a-Vah. and sorrow

מַפְּלֵ֣י <WH4651> map-pe-Lei The flakes בְשָׂר֣וֹ <WH1320> ve-sa-Ro of his flesh דָבֵ֑קוּ <WH1692> da-Ve-ku; are joined together יָצ֥וּק <WH3332> ya-Tzuk they are firm עָ֝לָ֗יו <WH5921> 'a-Lav, and בַּל־ <WH1077> bal- lest יִמּֽוֹט׃ <WH4131> yim-Mot. in themselves they cannot be moved

לִ֭בּוֹ <WH3820> lib-bo His heart יָצ֣וּק <WH3332> ya-Tzuk is as firm כְּמוֹ־ <WH3644> ke-mov- as אָ֑בֶן <WH68> 'A-ven; as a stone וְ֝יָצ֗וּק <WH3332> ve-ya-Tzuk, yea as hard כְּפֶ֣לַח <WH6400> ke-Fe-lach as a piece תַּחְתִּֽית׃ <WH8482> tach-Tit. of the nether

מִ֭שֵּׂתוֹ <WH7613> mis-se-to When he raiseth up יָג֣וּרוּ <WH1481> ya-Gu-ru are afraid אֵלִ֑ים <WH410> 'e-Lim; the mighty מִ֝שְּׁבָרִ֗ים <WH7667> mish-she-va-Rim, by reason of breakings יִתְחַטָּֽאוּ׃ <WH2398> yit-chat-Ta-'u. they purify

מַשִּׂיגֵ֣הוּ <WH5381> mas-si-Ge-hu of him that layeth חֶ֭רֶב <WH2719> Che-rev The sword בְּלִ֣י <WH1097> be-Li cannot תָק֑וּם <WH6965> ta-Kum; at him cannot hold חֲנִ֖ית <WH2595> cha-Nit the spear מַסָּ֣ע <WH4551> mas-Sa' the dart וְשִׁרְיָֽה׃ <WH8302> ve-shir-Yah. nor the habergeon

יַחְשֹׁ֣ב <WH2803> yach-Sho He esteemeth לְתֶ֣בֶן <WH8401> le-Te-ven as straw בַּרְזֶ֑ל <WH1270> bar-Zel; iron לְעֵ֖ץ <WH6086> le-'Etz wood רִקָּב֣וֹן <WH7539> rik-ka-Von as rotten נְחוּשָֽׁה׃ <WH5154> ne-chu-Shah. [and] brass

לֹֽא־ <WH3808> lo- cannot יַבְרִיחֶ֥נּוּ <WH1272> yav-ri-Chen-nu cannot make him flee בֶן־ <WH1121> ven- the arrow קָ֑שֶׁת <WH7198> Ka-shet; arch לְ֝קַ֗שׁ <WH7179> le-Kash, with him into stubble נֶהְפְּכוּ־ <WH2015> neh-pe-chu- are turned ל֥וֹ lo אַבְנֵי־ <WH68> 'av-nei- stones קָֽלַע׃ <WH7050> Ka-la'. hanging

כְּ֭קַשׁ <WH7179> Ke-kash as stubble נֶחְשְׁב֣וּ <WH2803> nech-she-Vu are counted תוֹתָ֑ח <WH8455> to-Tach; Darts וְ֝יִשְׂחַ֗ק <WH7832> ve-yis-Chak, he laugheth לְרַ֣עַשׁ <WH7494> le-Ra-'ash at the shaking כִּידֽוֹן׃ <WH3591> ki-Don. of a spear

תַּ֭חְתָּיו <WH8478> Tach-tav his underparts חַדּ֣וּדֵי <WH2303> chad-Du-dei Sharp חָ֑רֶשׂ <WH2789> Cha-res; stones יִרְפַּ֖ד <WH7502> yir-Pad [are] under him he spreadeth חָר֣וּץ <WH2742> cha-Rutz sharp pointed things עֲלֵי־ <WH5921> 'a-lei- on טִֽיט׃ <WH2916> Tit. upon the mire

יַרְתִּ֣יחַ <WH7570> yar-Ti-ach to boil כַּסִּ֣יר <WH5518> kas-Sir like a pot מְצוּלָ֑ה <WH4688> me-tzu-Lah; He maketh the deep יָ֝֗ם <WH3220> Yam, the sea יָשִׂ֥ים <WH7760> ya-Sim he maketh כַּמֶּרְקָחָֽה׃ <WH4841> kam-mer-ka-Chah. like a pot of ointment

אַ֭חֲרָיו <WH310> 'A-cha-rav after יָאִ֣יר <WH215> ya-'Ir to shine נָתִ֑יב <WH5410> na-Tiv; He maketh a path יַחְשֹׁ֖ב <WH2803> yach-Sho him [one] would think תְּה֣וֹם <WH8415> te-Hom the deep לְשֵׂיבָֽה׃ <WH7872> le-sei-Vah. [to be] hoary אֵֽין־ <WH369> 'ein- else עַל־ <WH5921> 'al- on

עָפָ֥ר <WH6083> 'a-Far Upon earth מָשְׁל֑וֹ <WH4915> ma-she-Lo; there is not his like הֶ֝עָשׂ֗וּ <WH6213> he-'a-Su, who is made לִבְלִי־ <WH1097> liv-li- without חָֽת׃ <WH2844> Chat. fear אֵֽת־ <WH853> 'et- כָּל־ <WH3605> kol- that

גָּבֹ֥הַּ <WH1364> ga-Vo-ah all high יִרְאֶ֑ה <WH7200> yir-'Eh; He beholdeth ה֝֗וּא <WH1931> Hu, He מֶ֣לֶךְ <WH4428> Me-lech [things] he [is] a king עַל־ <WH5921> 'al- over כָּל־ <WH3605> kol- everything בְּנֵי־ <WH1121> be-nei- over all the children שָֽׁחַץ׃ <WH7830> Sha-chatz. of pride ס sa-Mek
